content.1: Come down, and sit in the dust, O virgin daughter of Babylon, sit on the ground:
content.2: Take the millstones, and grind meal: uncover thy locks, make bare the leg, uncover the thigh, pass over the rivers.
content.3: Thy nakedness shall be uncovered, yea, thy shame shall be seen: I will take vengeance, and I will not meet
content.5: Sit thou silent, and get thee into darkness, O daughter of the Chaldeans: for thou shalt no more be called, The lady of kingdoms.
content.6: I was wroth with my people, I have polluted mine inheritance, and given them into thine hand: thou didst shew them no mercy; upon the ancient hast thou very heavily laid thy yoke.
content.7: And thou saidst, I shall be a lady for ever:

content.11: Therefore shall evil come upon thee; thou shalt not know from whence it riseth: and mischief shall fall upon thee; thou shalt not be able to put it off: and desolation shall come upon thee suddenly,
content.12: Stand now with thine enchantments, and with the multitude of thy sorceries, wherein thou hast laboured from thy youth; if so be thou shalt be able to profit, if so be thou mayest prevail.

content.14: Behold, they shall be as stubble; the fire shall burn them; they shall not deliver themselves from the power of the flame:
